alert.note: Alert for San Mateo; Santa Clara; Santa Cruz (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 21 at 6:01PM PDT until further notice by NWS Monterey
info.description: .Rain will continue through the evening as low pressure off the SF Peninsula coast continues to spin in place, bringing continued rain between Half Moon Bay and the Santa Cruz Mountains. Rain rates up to 0.2" an hour being observed. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM PDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northern California, including the following counties, San Mateo, Santa Clara and Santa Cruz. * WHEN...Until 900 PM PDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 558 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding. Between 0.75 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.3 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Redwood City, Palo Alto, Santa Cruz, Cupertino, Menlo Park, Saratoga, Los Gatos, Scotts Valley, Half Moon Bay, Capitola, Live Oak, Los Altos Hills, Atherton, Woodside, Boulder Creek, Ben Lomond, Felton, Twin Lakes, Soquel and Opal Cliffs. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.

area.areaDesc: San Mateo; Santa Clara; Santa Cruz
